snippet: Troops have begun deploying in the wake of President Goodluck Jonathan’s declaration of a state of emergency in parts of the north, but critics fear more civilian deaths.
abstract: Nigeria's Pres Goodluck Jonathan, struggling to contain a smoldering Islamist insurgency in Africa’s most populous country, orders in more troops and grants the military more powers; declares state of emergency in parts of north, but critics fear more civilians deaths in military crackdown.

byline.contributor: Ini Ekott contributed reporting from Abuja, Nigeria, and Hamza Idris from Maiduguri, Nigeria.

lead_paragraph: Troops have begun deploying in the wake of President Goodluck Jonathan’s declaration of a state of emergency in parts of the north, but critics fear more civilian deaths.

headline.seo: Nigeria Military Gets More Power to Fight Rebels
headline.main: Nigeria’s President Gives Military More Power in Struggle Against Militants
